nodes.text: Congratulations on your defeat of the Queen Drat. How did you do it?
Well, you see, it was like this...
... and that's why there are no Warrior Drats wandering around the halls.
Wow, that was quite an experience. You really are a true hero, Shawn.
Not only did I have to face the fierce Queen of the Drats, I had to confront the Undead and speak with Ghosts, avoid death traps, and defeat the Stone Guardian that barred the way.
First, I had to sneak along a secret passageway that was so icy cold, it felt like it was sucking my soul away...
... and so, the Queen fell lifeless to the dungeon floor upon the corpses of so many of her followers, and I staunched my bleeding and stumbled back to safety.
That's incredible, Shawn. You are a true hero, as worthy as any Paladin.
That's incredible, Shawn. Defeating an army of Wraiths with only a dagger? It's hard to believe that you survived against such overwhelming odds.
I never would have succeeded without the help of my friends, Thomas. All those Rogue lessons saved my life.
<shrug>
I can't believe that Caesari stopped the Drat Invasion. He's too much of a cad to go out of his way for anyone other than himself.
I know that it had to be you who saved the school from the Drats. You are brave and heroic.
So what's new with you today?
I keep thinking about the other night with you. I can't wait to meet with you again soon.

nodes.message: The Garden date can only happen once; so make sure it isn't duplicated.

options.text: Ask to Meet Thomas later in the Tower Garden

nodes.text: So would you like to meet in the Tower Garden later tonight after curfew?

nodes.name: A Late Date in the Garden
nodes.description: Thomas agreed to meet me in the garden later tonight. I can't wait for our date!

nodes.text: There's nothing I'd rather do than spend some time with you.
I'm studying for the final exam. Can you believe how quickly this semester passed by? It's almost over.
So how did you and Esme stop the Drat Invasion?

Esme showed me the Queen Drat's lair in the Wine Cellar, but we couldn't get through the door. I researched the dungeon and its traps. Together, Esme and I explored until we found the back entrance to the Queen.
Esme did most of the fighting and I used traps and bombs to kill the Drats.
We forced the Queen to surrender and leave the castle forever.
Nice going. You and Esme saved the school. Clearly, you don't need to be a Paladin to be a hero.
When we confronted the Queen of the Drats, she told us that the Drats were looking for her missing broach. After Esme and I found the item, she and her Drats went off.
Nice going. You and Esme saved the school. Clearly, you don't need to be a Paladin to be a hero.
Read anything good lately?
The only thing I'm reading about right now is all my notes on the class lessons. I want to make sure I pass the final with the best grade that I can make.
You study harder than anyone I've met. Obviously, all that hard work of yours has paid off.
The way I see it, if you don't know the Rogue lessons by now, you'll never know them. There's no point in trying to cram stuff into your brain at the last moment.
You won't learn how to be a Rogue in a book. Good grades are meaningless. It's not what you know that makes you a Rogue; it's what you do.
Would you like to study our lessons together for a bit? I might learn something.
I can think of no better way to study right now.
I learn so much more when I hear you talk about things.
And I learn so much better when I try to talk about these things. We both win when we study together.
You know what? You're cute. How about I take you out on a romantic evening snuggling together under the light of the stars?
I'd like that, Shawn. I'd like that very much.
No. I'm sorry Shawn, but I don't want to go out with you. You're a nice guy, but you're not my type.
See you later!
I'll see you in the garden in the moonlight!
Good night, Shawn. At least you won't be fighting Drats just to get back to the dorm room.
